post.description: This endpoint allows you to get an authentication token. No need to be authenticated to use this endpoint.

parameters.name: Content-type
parameters.description: Equal to 'application/json' or 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded', no other value allowed

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Equal to 'Basic xx', where 'xx' is the base 64 encoding of the client id and secret. Find out how to generate them in the Client ID/secret generation section.

access_token.description: Authentication token that should be given in every authenticated request to the API

expires_in.description: Validity of the token given in seconds, 3600s = 1h by default

refresh_token.description: Use this token when your access token has expired. See Refresh an expired token section for more details.

message.example: Invalid JSON message received
‘xxx’ in ‘Content-type’ header is not valid.  Only ‘application/json’ is allowed.
Property "labels" expects an array as data, "NULL" given. Check the API reference documentation.

get.description: This endpoint allows you to get the information about a given asset family.

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: Code of the resource

attribute_as_main_media.description: Attribute code that is used as the main media of the asset family.

localeCode.description: Asset family label for the locale `localeCode`

labels.description: Asset family labels for each locale

abort_asset_creation_on_error.description: Whether the asset should be created if the naming convention failed to apply. More details here.

pattern.description: The regular expression that should be applied on the source. More details here.

source.description: The string on which the naming convention should be applied. More details here.

naming_convention.description: The naming convention ran over the asset code or the main media filename upon each asset creation, in order to automatically set several values in asset attributes. To learn more and see the format of this property, take a look at here.

product_link_rules.description: The rules that will be run after the asset creation, in order to automatically link the assets of this family to a set of products. To understand the format of this property, see here.

assign_assets_to.description: The product value in which your assets will be assigned. More details here.

product_selections.description: The product selection to which the assets of the asset family to be automatically linked. More details here.

transformations.description: The transformations to perform on source files in order to generate new files into your asset attributes (only available since v4.0). To understand the format of this property, see here.

filename_prefix.description: The prefix that will be prepended to the source filename to generate the target filename. More details here.

filename_suffix.description: The suffix that will be appended to the source filename to generate the target filename. More details here.

operations.description: The transformations that should be applied to your source file to generate the target file. More details here.

source.description: The attribute value in which is stored the media file you want to use as the source file for your transformation. More details here.

target.description: The attribute value in which the PIM will generate the new transformed file, aka the target file. More details here.

transformations.label: Thumbnail plus black and white transformation

number_min.description: Minimum integer value allowed when the attribute type is `pim_catalog_metric`, `pim_catalog_price` or `pim_catalog_number`

reference_data_name.description: Reference entity code when the attribute type is `akeneo_reference_entity` or `akeneo_reference_entity_collection` OR Asset family code when the attribute type is `pim_catalog_asset_collection`

scopable.description: Whether the attribute is scopable, i.e. can have one value by channel

sort_order.description: Order of the attribute in its group

is_required_for_completeness.description: Defines if the column should be entirely filled for the attribute to be considered complete

decimals_allowed.description: whether the value of a numeric cell can hold a decimal part

max.description: maximum value of a numeric cell

max_length.description: maximum length of a text cell

min.description: minimum value of a numeric cell

validations.description: User defined validation constraints on the cell content

type.description: Attribute type. See type section for more details.

unique.description: Whether two values for the attribute cannot be the same

useable_as_grid_filter.description: Whether the attribute can be used as a filter for the product grid in the PIM user interface

validation_regexp.description: Regexp expression used to validate any attribute value when the attribute type is `pim_catalog_text` or `pim_catalog_identifier`

validation_rule.description: Validation rule type used to validate any attribute value when the attribute type is `pim_catalog_text` or `pim_catalog_identifier`

wysiwyg_enabled.description: Whether the WYSIWYG interface is shown when the attribute type is `pim_catalog_textarea`

post.summary: Create a new product media file
post.description: This endpoint allows you to create a new media file and associate it to an attribute value of a given product or product model.

parameters.name: Content-type
parameters.description: Equal to 'multipart/form-data', no other value allowed

product.description: The product to which the media file will be associated. It is a JSON string that follows this format '{"identifier":"product_identifier", "attribute":"attribute_code", "scope":"channel_code","locale":"locale_code"}'. You have to either use this field or the `product_model` field, but not both at the same time.

product_model.description: The product model to which the media file will be associated. It is a JSON string that follows this format '{"code":"product_model_code", "attribute":"attribute_code", "scope":"channel_code","locale":"locale_code"}'. You have to either use this field or the `product` field, but not both at the same time.

parameters.description: Uuid of the resource

parameters.name: with_attribute_options
parameters.description: Return labels of attribute options in the response. (Only available since the 5.0 version)

parameters.name: with_quality_scores
parameters.description: Return product quality scores in the response. (Only available since the 5.0 version)

parameters.name: with_completenesses
parameters.description: Return product completenesses in the response. (Only available since the 6.0 version)

groups.description: Array of groups codes with which the product is in relation

product_models.description: Array of product model codes with which the product is in relation (only available since the v2.1)

products.description: Array of product uuids with which the product is in relation

associations.description: Several associations related to groups, product models and/or other products, grouped by association types

categories.description: Codes of the categories in which the product is classified

completenesses.description: Product completenesses for each channel/locale combination (only available since the 7.0 version, and when the "with_completenesses" query parameter is set to "true")

family.description: Family code from which the product inherits its attributes and attributes requirements.
family.default: null only in the case of a non variant product

groups.description: Codes of the groups to which the product belong

workflow_status.description: Status of the product regarding the user permissions

metadata.description: More information around the product (only available since the v2.0 in the Enterprise Edition)

parent.description: Code of the parent product model when the product is a variant (only available since the 2.0). This parent can be modified since the 2.3.

quality_scores.description: Product quality scores for each channel/locale combination (only available since the 5.0 and when the "with_quality_scores" query parameter is set to "true")

product_models.description: Array of objects containing product model codes and quantities with which the product is in relation

products.description: Array of objects containing product uuids and quantities with which the product is in relation

quantified_associations.description: Several quantified associations related to products and/or product models, grouped by quantified association types (only available since the 5.0)

data.description: Product value. See the `data` format section for more details.

linked_data.description: Object containing labels of attribute options (only available since the 5.0 and when query parameter "with_attribute_options" is set to "true"). See the `linked_data` format section for more details.

values.description: Product attributes values, see Product values section for more details

message.example: Authentication is required
Access forbidden. You are not allowed to list categories.
Resource `my_resource_code` does not exist.
‘xxx’ in ‘Accept‘ header is not valid. Only ‘application/json‘ is allowed.

get.description: This endpoint allows you to get a list of published products. Published products are paginated and they can be filtered.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Filter published products, for more details see the Filters section

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: Filter published product values to return scopable attributes for the given channel as well as the non localizable/non scopable attributes, for more details see the Filter on published product values section

parameters.name: locales
parameters.description: Filter published product values to return localizable attributes for the given locales as well as the non localizable/non scopable attributes, for more details see the Filter on published product values section

parameters.name: attributes
parameters.description: Filter published product values to only return those concerning the given attributes, for more details see the Filter on product values section

parameters.name: pagination_type
parameters.description: Pagination method type, see Pagination section

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Number of the page to retrieve when using the `page` pagination method type. Should never be set manually, see Pagination section

parameters.name: search_after
parameters.description: Cursor when using the `search_after` pagination method type. Should never be set manually, see Pagination section

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results by page, see Pagination section

parameters.name: with_count
parameters.description: Return the count of items in the response. Be carefull with that, on a big catalog, it can decrease performance in a significative way

href.description: URI of the first page of resources
URI of the next page of resources
URI of the previous page of resources
URI of the current page of resources

message.example: Invalid JSON message received
Authentication is required
Access forbidden. You are not allowed to list categories.
‘xxx’ in ‘Accept‘ header is not valid. Only ‘application/json‘ is allowed.
Property "labels" expects an array as data, "NULL" given. Check the API reference documentation.

get.description: This endpoint allows you to get the information about a given published product.

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: Code of the resource

groups.description: Array of groups codes with which the published product is in relation

product_models.description: Array of product model codes with which the product is in relation (only available since the v2.1)

products.description: Array of published product identifiers with which the published product is in relation

associations.description: Several associations related to groups and/or other published products, grouped by association types

categories.description: Codes of the categories in which the published product is classified

enabled.description: Whether the published product is enable

family.description: Family code from which the published product inherits its attributes and attributes requirements

groups.description: Codes of the groups to which the published product belong

identifier.description: Published product identifier, i.e. the value of the only `pim_catalog_identifier` attribute

quantified_associations.description: Warning: associations with quantities are not compatible with the published products. The response will always be empty.

data.description: Product value

values.description: Published product attributes values, see Product values section for more details

message.example: Authentication is required
Access forbidden. You are not allowed to list categories.
Resource `my_resource_code` does not exist.
‘xxx’ in ‘Accept‘ header is not valid. Only ‘application/json‘ is allowed.

post.summary: Create a new media file for a reference entity or a record

get.summary: Get the list of attributes of a given reference entity
get.description: This endpoint allows you to get the list of attributes of a given reference entity.

parameters.name: reference_entity_code
parameters.description: Code of the reference entity

200.description: Return the attributes of the given reference entity

allowed_extensions.description: Extensions allowed when the attribute type is `image`

decimals_allowed.description: Whether decimals are allowed when the attribute type is `number`

is_required_for_completeness.description: Whether the attribute should be part of the record's completeness calculation

is_rich_text_editor.description: Whether the UI should display a rich text editor instead of a simple text area when the attribute type is `text`

is_textarea.description: Whether the UI should display a text area instead of a simple field when the attribute type is `text`

max_characters.description: Maximum number of characters allowed for the value of the attribute when the attribute type is `text`

max_file_size.description: Max file size in MB when the attribute type is `image`

max_value.description: Maximum value allowed when the attribute type is `number`

min_value.description: Minimum value allowed when the attribute type is `number`

reference_entity_code.description: Code of the linked reference entity when the attribute type is `reference_entity_single_link` or `reference_entity_multiple_links`

type.description: Attribute type. See type section for more details.

validation_regexp.description: Regexp expression used to validate the attribute value when the attribute type is `text`

validation_rule.description: Validation rule type used to validate the attribute value when the attribute type is `text`

value_per_channel.description: Whether the attribute is scopable, i.e. can have one value by channel

value_per_locale.description: Whether the attribute is localizable, i.e. can have one value by locale

message.example: Authentication is required
‘xxx’ in ‘Accept‘ header is not valid. Only ‘application/json‘ is allowed.
